newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midwest spot power market remains in doldrums.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midwest spot power market remains in doldrums.

text.p: The spot electricity market Wednesday remained in the doldrums amid flat power demand due to normal to lower-than-normal temperatures in the region, market sources said.
Most marketers said short-term physical trading was featureless because of subdued buying interest.
Regional utilities have been able to meet current usage levels with production mainly from coal and nuclear stations, thusly keeping generation costs low, marketers said.
"The coal units are running in the mid-teens," noted one local utility trader, referring to the average per-megawatt- hour generation costs of the region's coal-fired power plants.
In the East Central Area Reliability Coordination Agreement (ECAR), non-firm, peak electricity for Thursday delivery was quoted at $18.00-$19.00 per megawatt hour (MWh), flat from Tuesday's values.
Non-firm, off-peak ECAR power for next-day delivery was discussed in the $11.00-$13.00, near unchanged from Tuesday.
Next-day electricity for delivery at the border of ECAR and the Pennsylvania-New Jersey-Maryland (PJM) Interconnect power pool was offered in the $23.00 area, compared with $22.00-$23.00 on Monday.
In the Mid-American Interpool Network (MAIN), non-firm, peak power prices for Thursday were assessed at $20.00-$21.00, flat from Tuesday.

MAIN power for non-firm, off-peak delivery Thursday was valued at $11.00-$13.00, unchanged from Tuesday's quotes. In the Mid-Continent Area Power Pool (MAPP), non-firm, peak electricity for Thursday was quoted at $17.50-$19.00, compared with Tuesday's $18.00-$19.00 range.
MAPP electricity for non-firm, off-peak delivery was pegged at $10.00-$12.00, up from Tuesday's $9.00-$11.00.
In the Southwest Power Pool (SPP), non-firm, peak electricity for Thursday was assessed at $18.00-$19.00 with deals reported at $18.20, compared with Tuesday's quotes in the $18.00 area.
Fourth-quarter 1996 SPP deals were heard done today in the $18.50-$18.60 range, marketers said.
The ECAR district includes Ohio, Indiana, Kentucky, lower Michigan, western Pennsylvania, northern Tennessee and northwestern Virginia.

The MAPP region is made up of Nebraska, Minnesota, the Dakotas, eastern Montana and western Wisconsin, and the MAIN district includes Illinois, northeastern Missouri, eastern Wisconsin and the Michigan pennisula.
The SPP region includes Kansas, Oklahoma, Louisiana, Arkansas, parts of eastern and northern Texas, southeastern New Mexico, southwestern Missouri and western Mississippi.
